name: Yorkshire Terrier
metaDescription: Yorkshire Terriers face dental disease, knee problems, and liver issues. Compare the best pet insurance for Yorkies—coverage for luxating patella, dental & more.
intro: Yorkshire Terriers are tiny but can rack up big vet bills. Dental disease, knee problems, and liver issues are common in this breed. Don't let their small size fool you—Yorkies need solid insurance coverage.
whyInsurance: Yorkies are prone to dental disease (their tiny mouths cause severe crowding), luxating patella (kneecap issues), and liver shunts. Surgery for these conditions can cost thousands.

costIntro: Yorkies are inexpensive to insure due to their small size. Here's what to expect:

faqs.question: Are Yorkies expensive to insure?
faqs.answer: No, Yorkshire Terriers are among the cheapest breeds to insure—typically $30-55/month. Their small size means lower surgery costs, though dental and knee issues can still be expensive.

faqs.question: Why do Yorkies have so many dental problems?
faqs.answer: Their tiny jaws can't accommodate all their teeth properly, leading to severe crowding, decay, and gum disease. Many Yorkies need teeth extracted. Look for insurance covering dental illness.

faqs.question: Is pet insurance worth it for a Yorkie?
faqs.answer: Yes, particularly for knee problems and potential liver issues. Surgery for a liver shunt can cost $10,000+. Even dental disease adds up over their long lifespan.

faqs.question: What is luxating patella?
faqs.answer: A condition where the kneecap slides out of place, common in toy breeds like Yorkies. It causes pain and lameness, often requiring surgery at $1,500-$3,500 per knee.

faqs.question: Should I get wellness coverage for my Yorkie?
faqs.answer: Wellness coverage can be worthwhile since Yorkies need regular dental cleanings. However, do the math—sometimes paying out of pocket costs less than wellness plan premiums.

finalCta: Protect your tiny Yorkie from big vet bills. Compare quotes and find the right coverage today.
